title: AI's Suicide Problem Knows No Borders
description: How are Chinese artificial intelligence developers protecting their most vulnerable users? A string of dystopian headlines in the US about suicide and youth mental health has put mounting pressure on Silicon Valley, but we’re not seeing a similar wave of cases in China. Initial testing suggests that they may be doing something right, although it’s just as likely such cases would never see the light of day in China’s tightly controlled media environment.

title: OpenAI signs multi-billion dollar chip deal with AMD
description: OpenAI signed a multi-year partnership Monday with chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices as the ChatGPT-maker continues an investment spree to secure massive amounts of computing power for rolling out generative artificial intelligence. title: With AI help, hit Pak assets with 94% accuracy in Op Sindoor: Army
description: Historical data of 26 years processed through artificial intelligence (AI) provided the Army accurate information on the Pakistan Army’s movement during Operation Sindoor and aided it in pinpoint targeting.
content:

title: CoreWeave plans to acquire Monolith AI to strengthen its industrial position
description: CoreWeave (CRWV) announced it plans to acquire Monolith AI, a U.K.-based software firm that uses artificial intelligence to enable machine learning for engineering and physics, to help strengthen its position in industrial sectors.

title: Use of AI in cybersecurity surges in Singapore
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is no longer a futuristic concept in cybersecurity but is now the frontline. Fortinet, a global leader in cybersecurity, has unveiled findings from a 2025 IDC survey that show a dramatic surge in AI adoption across Singapore’s enterprises, with 82% of organisations already integrating AI into their security operations.
